data.enText: franker
frankest

data.chText: 坦率的；直率的
data.enText: honest and direct in what you say, sometimes in a way that other people might not like

data.chText: 坦诚的充分讨论
data.enText: a full and frank discussion

data.chText: 坦率承认心里有愧
data.enText: a frank admission of guilt

data.chText: 他对自己和那位女演员的关系直言不讳。
data.enText: He was very frank about his relationship with the actress.

data.chText: 坦诚相告，我认为你的儿子不大可能通过考试。
data.enText: To be frank with you , I think your son has little chance of passing the exam.

data.chText: 他们友好坦诚地简述了他们的宗旨。
data.enText: They outlined their aims with disarming frankness.

data.chText: （在信件上）盖邮资已付印记，盖免付邮资印记
data.enText: to stamp a mark on an envelope, etc. to show that the cost of posting it has been paid or does not need to be paid

data.text: honest ♦ frank ♦ direct ♦ open ♦ outspoken ♦ straight ♦ blunt

data.chText: 以上各词均形容人坦率、坦诚。
data.enText: These words all describe people saying exactly what they mean without trying to hide feelings, opinions or facts.
honest

data.chText: 指坦率的、坦诚的：
data.enText: not hiding the truth about sth

data.chText: 感谢你对我这么坦诚。
data.enText: Thank you for being so honest with me.
frank

data.chText: 指坦率的、直率的（有时可能不讨人喜欢）：
data.enText: honest in what you say, sometimes in a way that other people might not like

data.chText: 坦白说，我认为你的儿子不大可能通过考试。
data.enText: To be frank with you, I think your son has little chance of passing the exam.
direct

data.chText: 指直接的、直率的、坦率的：
data.enText: saying exactly what you mean in a way that nobody can pretend not to understand

data.chText: 你得慢慢习惯他这种直率的方式。
data.enText: You'll have to get used to his direct manner.

data.chText: direct有时被认为含褒义，但有时是以礼貌的方式表示某人有些粗鲁。
data.enText: Being direct is sometimes considered positive but sometimes it is used as a ‘polite’ way of saying that sb is rude.
open

data.chText: 指为人诚恳的、坦诚的、直率的：
data.enText: ( approving ) (of a person) not keeping thoughts and feelings hidden

data.chText: 他对离开的原因完全未加隐瞒。
data.enText: He was quite open about his reasons for leaving.
outspoken

data.chText: 指直率的、坦诚的、直言不讳的：
data.enText: saying exactly what you think, even if this shocks or offends people

data.chText: 她对该计划的批评直言不讳。
data.enText: She was outspoken in her criticism of the plan.
straight

data.chText: 指坦诚的、直率的：
data.enText: honest and direct

data.chText: 我觉得你没跟我坦诚相见。
data.enText: I don't think you're being straight with me.
blunt

data.chText: 指嘴直的、直言不讳的：
data.enText: saying exactly what you think without trying to be polite

data.chText: 她说话出了名的直截了当。
data.enText: She has a reputation for blunt speaking.

data.chText: 词语辨析
honest和frank既指说话方式，也指说话内容：
data.enText: Honest and frank refer to what you say as much as how you say it.

data.chText: 坦承有错
data.enText: an honest/a frank admission of guilt

data.chText: 两词基本上含褒义，尽管有可能过分直率而不讨人喜欢。
data.enText: They are generally positive words, although it is possible to be too frank in a way that other people might not like.

data.chText: direct、outspoken和blunt均指说话直截了当；outspoken暗含说自己认为正确的话而不惜开罪于人；blunt和direct常含认为诚实比礼貌更重要之义；open含褒义，形容人的性格：
data.enText: Direct , outspoken and blunt all describe sb's manner of saying what they think. Outspoken suggests that you are willing to shock people by saying what you believe to be right. Blunt and direct often suggest that you think honesty is more important than being polite. Open is positive and describes sb's character.

data.chText: 我这个人非常坦诚直率。
data.enText: I'm a very open person.
which word?
to be honest/frank/direct/open/outspoken/straight/blunt
honest/frank/direct/open/outspoken/straight about sth
honest/frank/direct/open/straight/blunt with sb
a(n) honest/frank/direct/straight/blunt answer
a(n) frank/direct/open/outspoken/blunt person/manner
quite/very/really/extremely honest/frank/direct/open/outspoken/straight/blunt
rather frank/outspoken
To be/Let's be honest/frank/blunt… (= what I really think is…)

word_means: 盖邮资已付印记，盖免付邮资印记

means: (在信件上)盖邮资已付印记，盖免付邮资印记

ex.chText: 她期待能得到一些坦率而真实的回答。
ex.enText: She expected to have some plain and truthful answers.

synonyms.bx: 强调坦诚的、如实表达所思所想的。

ex.chText: 说得不客气一点，很多申请人英语水平都不高。
ex.enText: To be blunt, many of the candidates only have a low level of English.

ex.chText: 她唐突的话语大大地伤害了他。
ex.enText: Her blunt words hurt him so much.

synonyms.bx: 强调直言不讳的，即便可能使别人不悦。

ex.chText: 两位领导人的谈话直率而坦诚。
ex.enText: The conversation between the two leaders was direct and candid.

synonyms.bx: 强调直率的，即使事实令人不舒服或尴尬也要直言相告，不加以隐瞒。

ex.enText: Please give me a direct answer.

ex.chText: 她有时觉得她丈夫太率直了。
ex.enText: She sometimes feels that her husband is too direct.
We have had a frank talk.

ex.chText: 他对你也许不完全坦诚。
ex.enText: He was perhaps not entirely frank with you.

synonyms.bx: 强调有话直说的，不隐瞒自己的观点、意见等。

tr: a smooth-textured sausage of minced beef or pork usually smoked
often served on a bread roll
exempt by means of an official pass or letter, as from customs or other checks
stamp with a postmark to indicate date and time of mailing
characterized by directness in manner or speech
example: I gave them my candid opinion
a forthright approach to the problem
tell me what you think--and you may just as well be frank
it is possible to be outspoken without being rude

value.def: If someone is frank, they state or express things in an open and honest way.

example.ex: 'It is clear that my client has been less than frank with me,' said his lawyer...
example.tran: “很明显我的委托人对我不够坦白，”他的律师说。

example.ex: They had a frank discussion about the issue.
example.tran: 他们对这个问题进行了开诚布公的讨论。

example.ex: You can talk frankly to me...
He now frankly admits that much of his former playboy lifestyle was superficial.
example.tran: 他现在坦率承认自己以前浪荡不羁的生活方式很大程度上都是浅薄的。

example.ex: The reaction to his frankness was hostile.
example.tran: 他的坦诚却得到了充满敌意的回应。

value.def: When a letter or parcel is franked, it is marked with a symbol that shows that the proper charge has been paid or that no stamp is needed.

example.ex: The letter was franked in London on August 6.
example.tran: 这封信 8 月 6 日在伦敦盖过免费邮戳。
署明回邮地址且已付邮资的信封

value.tran: (在信封或邮包上)盖邮资已付戳记，盖免费邮戳

value.def: You can say 'to be frank' or 'to be frank with you' to introduce a statement which is your honest opinion, especially when the person you are talking to might not like it.

example.ex: To be frank, he could also be a bit of a bore...
example.tran: 老实说，他有时也会让人厌烦。

example.ex: To be frank with you, Harvey, I may have made a mistake.
example.tran: 老实跟你讲，哈维，我可能犯了个错。

value.tran: (尤用于观点可能令人不悦时)老实讲，坦白说

trans: 弗兰克-兰帕德；弗兰克 兰帕德；兰帕德；弗兰克兰帕德；蓝帕德
法兰克辛纳屈；弗兰克·辛纳特拉；弗兰克西纳特拉；弗兰克•辛纳特拉
